newsitem.title: ITALY: FORECAST - Italy seen issuing 10.75 trln lire BOTs.
newsitem.headline: FORECAST - Italy seen issuing 10.75 trln lire BOTs.

text.p: The Italian Treasury is expected to issue between 10 and 11.5 trillion lire of short-term bills (BOTs) at auction on June 10, analysts polled by Reuters said on Thursday.
The average of analysts' forecasts was for 10.75 trillion lire to be issued against 11.75 trillion lire of BOTs maturing.

The Treasury is also expected to offer two trillion lire of 18-month zero coupon certificates (CTZs) together with 2.5 trillion lire of 24-month CTZs, whereas no zero coupon certificates fall due in June.
The Treasury will detail the amount it will offer on Friday, while settlement date for the papers is on June 15.
